objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate whether the addition of ibrutinib to bendamustine and rituximab will result in prolongation of progression-free survival (PFS) in subjects with newly diagnosed MCL who are 65 years of age or older.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Overall Survival
objectives.text: Evaluation of overall survival

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - CR Rate
objectives.text: Evaluation of CR rate

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - ORR
objectives.text: Evaluation of overall response rate (CR+ partial response [PR])

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Patient-Reported Symptoms
objectives.text: Evaluation of patient-reported lymphoma symptoms and concerns as measured by the lymphoma (Lym) subscale of the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lymphoma (FACT-Lym)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - MRD
objectives.text: Evaluation of minimal residual disease (MRD) negative rate

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Duration of Response
objectives.text: Evaluation of duration of response

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - TTNT
objectives.text: Evaluation of time-to-next treatment (TTNT)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Safety
objectives.text: Evaluation of safety of ibrutinib when combined with BR

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Pharmacokinetics
objectives.text: To characterize the pharmacokinetics of ibrutinib and explore the potential relationships between ibrutinib metrics of exposure with relevant clinical, pharmacodynamic, or biomarker information

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - PRO
objectives.text: To evaluate patient-reported outcomes (PRO) related to well-being and general health status utilizing the FACT-Lym and EuroQol (EQ-5D-5L)

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Biomarkers
objectives.text: To explore biomarkers identified from other studies of ibrutinib in samples collected for MRD assessments

endpoints.name: Primary Efficacy Endpoint
endpoints.text: Progression-free survival (PFS) as determined by investigators

endpoints.name: Overall Survival
endpoints.text: Overall survival

endpoints.name: CR Rate
endpoints.text: Complete response (CR) rate

endpoints.name: Overall Response Rate
endpoints.text: Overall response rate (CR+ partial response [PR])

endpoints.name: FACT-Lym Subscale
endpoints.text: Lymphoma (Lym) subscale of the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lymphoma (FACT-Lym)

endpoints.name: MRD Negative Rate
endpoints.text: Minimal residual disease (MRD) negative rate

endpoints.name: Duration of Response
endpoints.text: Duration of response

endpoints.name: Time-to-next treatment
endpoints.text: Time-to-next treatment (TTNT)

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoints
endpoints.text: Safety assessed by physical examinations, ECOG criteria, laboratory tests, monitoring adverse events, and concomitant medication usage

endpoints.name: Pharmacokinetic Parameters
endpoints.text: Model-derived plasma concentrations or metrics of exposure parameters (eg, maximum observed plasma concentration [Cmax] or area under the plasma concentration versus time curve [AUC])

endpoints.name: Exploratory PRO
endpoints.text: Patient-reported outcomes (PRO) related to well-being and general health status utilizing the FACT-Lym and EuroQol (EQ-5D-5L)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Biomarkers
endpoints.text: Biomarkers identified from other studies of ibrutinib in samples collected for MRD assessments

estimands.name: Primary Efficacy Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients 65 years of age or older with newly diagnosed mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) meeting eligibility criteria (ITT population) Summary measure: Hazard ratio.

intercurrentEvents.name: Discontinuation of study treatment for reasons other than progression
intercurrentEvents.text: Subject discontinues treatment due to adverse events or other reasons prior to disease progression

intercurrentEvents.name: Death
intercurrentEvents.text: Death from any cause prior to documented progression

intercurrentEvents.name: Subsequent anti-cancer therapy
intercurrentEvents.text: Initiation of a new systemic anti-MCL therapy prior to documented progression

estimands.treatment: Ibrutinib 560 mg daily + Bendamustine and Rituximab (BR) vs Placebo + Bendamustine and Rituximab (BR)
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients 65 years of age or older with newly diagnosed mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) meeting eligibility criteria (ITT population)
estimands.variableOfInterest: Progression-free survival (PFS) as determined by investigators

estimands.name: Overall Survival Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients 65 years of age or older with newly diagnosed mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) meeting eligibility criteria (ITT population) Summary measure: Hazard ratio.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment switching/Unblinding
intercurrentEvents.text: Placebo subjects unblinded and/or stopping placebo treatment following DMC recommendation

estimands.treatment: Ibrutinib 560 mg daily + BR vs Placebo + BR
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients 65 years of age or older with newly diagnosed mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) meeting eligibility criteria (ITT population)

estimands.name: Response Rate Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients 65 years of age or older with newly diagnosed mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) meeting eligibility criteria (ITT population) Summary measure: Odds ratio.

intercurrentEvents.name: Death or progression prior to response assessment
intercurrentEvents.text: Subject dies or has disease progression before a CR can be documented
